Detailed Description

An Averager that uses Gaussian kernels to approximate states.

In particular, for any given query state s, it assigns to each basis state x the weight e^(-d(x,s)^2 / b^2), where b is a generalization breadth and d is a scaled Euclidean distance function. Note that all weights therefore lie in the interval (0,1]. For efficiency reasons, a weight is set to zero if it falls below a certain threshold or if it is smaller than a certain fraction of the sum of the larger weights. (The tail of the distribution is truncated, since it has a small effect on the approximation.)

Constructs a new KernelAverager that begins with no basis states.

Parameters:
breadth The generalization breadth b
minweight The minimum nonzero value of a weight

const StateVariables & KernelAverager::dimensions (  )  const [virtual]

Specifies the importance of each state dimension to this Averager.

Returns:
A mapping whose keys comprise all the state dimensions that this Averager uses in its approximation. The data give the scaling coefficient for each of these dimensions.

Implements Averager.

__gnu_cxx::hash_set<StateVectorRef, StateHasher> KernelAverager::m_bases [private]

The subset of the keys of queries that are also bases.

This container does not own any of its keys.

Definition at line 206 of file averager.hh.

QueryContainer KernelAverager::m_queries [private]

Invariant: contains all the existing KernelAverages created by this KernelAverager.

The keys serve as both queries and bases (queries are a superset of bases), so a datum may be NULL if the associated key is just a basis, not a query.

Definition at line 226 of file averager.hh.
